data.title: Fix crash in web view on android
data.body:
Reason of crash - shouldStartLoading notification is executed from Java's thread.

I redirected calls to cocos thread. Now all looks fine ;)

data.title: PMA Handling issue
data.body:
Hi,

I compared to cocos2D-x v2.x and it seems that there is an issue with the _hasPremultipliedAlpha flag not beeing set correctly for mipmaps and compressed textures.
I guess it's a mistake due to the reorganization of the code between the old CCTexture2D and the new one.
In our tests, this fixes the issue.

Best,

Sebastien

data.title: Fix#22934
data.body: Node, Skeleton needs to show at the middle of the simulator.

data.title: Sprite3D culling
EventMouse and EventTouch report different values on Win32 platform
MotionStreak causes crashes sometimes (more details in the post)
data.body:
Hello,

I am currently developing a game with Cocos2d-x 3.7 (updated the project to 3.8.1 to check if the problem would magically go away, but it didn't. Same with cocos2d-x 3.9). The game is a kind of endless runner, and I am using the `cocos2d::MotionStreak` class to add a nice effect to the coins collected by the player. Coins travel to the coins counter when the player collides with them, and each coin has a MotionStreak effect.

You can see a video of the game here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Kaxf1Imu600

And a screenshot:
![a62f47b4-7d5b-11e5-9b6d-c598ba90c374](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2997598/10784073/437916bc-7d5c-11e5-986e-325c6e8bad4d.png)

I've been developing and testing the game for a couple of months and everything seemed fine. But someday I decided to dramatically increase the speed of the game, as a stress test or just for fun. But after some seconds of gameplay, a crash occurred: 

**Crash 1:**

`CCASSERT(_glprogram, "invalid glprogram");` <- EXC_BAD_ACCESS

![caf4a85340fe894e](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2997598/10507890/18acbcbe-7324-11e5-8cd6-427eab3bca8c.png)

I do not know how I ended suspecting of the MotionStreak effect, but I tried to comment the lines where I created and added the MotionStreak effect to each coin. And after a lot of games, I did not manage to reproduce the crash. To confirm that it was something about the MotionStreak, I enabled the MotionStreak effect again and it brought the crashes back.

I found it was a lot more frequent on older devices, such as the iPhone 4 or iPad mini 1, than on newer devices, like the iPod Touch 6. ~~I haven't tested it on Android as debugging is more difficult as I only want to use Xcode~~. **Edit:** I tested it on Android devices with same results: powerful devices such as LG G3 crash a lot less frequently than mid/low tier devices.

I also got other less frequent crashes:

**Crash 2:**

`CCASSERT(command->getType() != RenderCommand::Type::UNKNOWN_COMMAND, "Invalid Command Type");` <- Signal SIGABRT (the assertion did not succeed)

![310eaea3426dfe8c](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2997598/10507908/2add1a0a-7324-11e5-960b-feda69c4fb6a.png)

---

**Crash 3:**

`cocos2d::Renderer::fillQuads(cocos2d::QuadCommand *cmd)` <- EXC_BAD_ACCESS inside this function 

![cee1a9964f2831b2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2997598/10507915/3a0f7f22-7324-11e5-8ed5-3b63cfd6be01.png)

---

**Crash 4:**

`CCASSERT(cmd->getQuadCount()>= 0 && cmd->getQuadCount() * 4 < VBO_SIZE, "VBO for vertex is not big enough, please break the data down or use customized render command");` <- Signal SIGABRT  (the assertion did not succeed)

![a4274367402a157a](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2997598/10507917/3f5c00cc-7324-11e5-9680-630a1a8ca4e6.png)

---

You could say: "Hey, but your game ran perfectly before increasing the gameplay speed. Why don't you just set it as before?"

**The problem** is that the game's velocity slowly increases in order to become more difficult. Besides, I was planning to create a power up that boosts the player a lot. Not to mention the quantity of different compatible devices which could behave differently and crash at lower speeds.

I don't know, but it could be related to the way MotionStreak nodes load textures (for some reason I can't correctly use the sprite sheet here, as it shows the whole texture instead of only the portion corresponding to the trail texture), as I have to specify the texture apart from the sprite sheet:

`auto motionStreak = MotionStreak::create(fade, minSeg, stroke, Color3B(220, 255, 124), "trail.png");`

Any light on these dark MotionStreak crashes?

data.title: can not play audio if not playing any effect and come back from background on iOS
data.body:
15:47:15.912 ERROR:    [0x19e5fa000] >aurioc> 807: failed: '!pla' (enable 2, outf< 2 ch,  44100 Hz, Float32, non-inter> inf< 2 ch,      0 Hz, Float32, non-inter>)

IOS9 xcode7 cocos2d-x3.8.1

进入游戏后如果没有播放任何音效就切出游戏会报以上错误, 之后无法再播放任何音效
如果在进入游戏后播放过一次音效, 之后切出游戏不会再报错误

data.title: cocos/sdkbox import iap auto generated code bug
data.body:
Hi 
My setup is cocos on linux sdk and ndk from Android Studio installation.

I do 
cocos new -l cpp -d . -p <package> <projectname>
to create a new project
cd to the created directory and compile the project for android and/or android-studio
cocos compile -p android 
cocos compile -p android --android-studio
I test it on my mobile and it is ok.

Then I try to add iap with sdkbox
sdkbox import iap 

The operation successfully completes.

Then I try to re compile the project 

And I get an Error the on #include "PluginIAP/PluginIAP.h"  the this file does not exists.
and it does not cause the folder is "pluginiap" and not "PluginIAP"

jni/../../Classes/AppDelegate.cpp:3:33: fatal error: PluginIAP/PluginIAP.h: No such file or directory
 #include "PluginIAP/PluginIAP.h"

I changed "PluginIAP" to "pluginiap" and it compiles.

This line was inserted automatically from sdkbox it not a mistake I made.

P.S. Is there any complete guide with example on how to create a plugin for sdkbox.

data.title: Terrain render bug on some devices
data.body: Terrain can not be rendered correctly on MeiZu MX3 and IPOD5.

data.title: Remove screen direction check in simulator to avoid render error
data.body: Simulator set to landscape screen direction in default, when create a portrait scene in CocoStudio, the simulator try to set default scene size as landscape, it will make scene display in stretch mode can not fill the window.

data.title: V3 win10 curl
data.body:
This pull request adds the missing CURL support to the Windows 10 UWP version. It depends on the following commit to cocos2d-x-3rd-party-libs-bin

https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x-3rd-party-libs-bin/pull/180

I have updated the version in external/config.json to v3-deps-74 so this PR will not build until the above PR to cocos2d-x-3rd-party-libs-bin is made available.

Cocos2d-x 3.8.1 cpp template compile error
data.body:
版本: cocos2d-x 3.8.1 
操作:
1. cocos new -p com.x.xAct -l cpp -d . xAct 
2. 然后在 HelloWorldScene.h里面添加 
# include "cocos-ext.h"

USING_NS_CC;
USING_NS_CC_EXT; 
这样几行；
3.编译工程

failed msg:
\cocos2d\extensions\gui\cccontrolextension\cccontrolutils.h(39): fatal error C1083: Cannot open include file: 'extensions/ExtensionExport.h': No such file or directory (..\Classes\HelloWorldScene.cpp)
# \cocos2d\extensions\gui\cccontrolextension\cccontrolutils.h(39): fatal error C1083: Cannot open include file: 'extensions/ExtensionExport.h': No such file or directory (..\Classes\AppDelegate.cpp)

[bug][jsb_boot.js] getRes crash if url is null
data.body:
cocos\scripting\js-bindings\script\jsb_boot.js
"cc.path.extname(url)" can return null and variable "type" is not checking it and immediately calling "type.toLowerCase()".
And in function "extname", can checking pathStr on null.
